extendedIngredients.name: ground cinnamon
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 heaping teaspoons ground cinnamon, plus more for sprinkling on top
metaInformation: plus more for sprinkling on top

extendedIngredients.name: peaches
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups peeled & chopped fresh peaches (thawed, frozen peaches would work too)

extendedIngredients.name: sour cream
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/4 cups sour cream (I used light sour cream – regular or nonfat would work too)
metaInformation: (I used cream - regular or nonfat would work too)

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 Tbsp (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, melted and cooled slightly

recipes.title: Peach Pie Muffins with Brown Butter Glaze
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 425F.  Line 12-cup muffin tin with liners or spray with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.Whisk the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon in a medium bowl until combined.  In a separate bowl, whisk the egg until the yolk & white are combined and light-colored.  Add the sugars and stir until the mixture is thick.  Add the melted butter in 2 or 3 additions, whisking slowly to combine after each addition.  Add the sour cream and whisk until JUST combined.  Do not overmix.Add the peaches to the dry ingredients.  Slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients in 2 or 3 additions, carefully folding after each addition.  Stir until the batter comes together, but try not to over mix.  The batter will be very, very thick.Spoon the batter into prepared muffin tins.  Fill the tins all the way to the top.  Not 2/3 or halfway filled, ALL the way to the brim.  Bake at 425F for 5 minutes.  Reduce oven temperature to 350F and continue to bake for 20-22 more minutes.  Allow to cool for 5 minutes.While the muffins are cooling, prepare the glaze by browning the butter in a medium saucepan on medium heat.  Stir constantly until butter is brown with a light nutty aroma, about 7 minutes.  Watch closely and do not burn.  Once browned, remove from heat and transfer to a small bowl.  Stir in sifted powdered sugar and milk/cream.  Stir until completely smooth.Once muffins are cooled, dip into brown butter glaze and sprinkle with cinnamon.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 425F.  Line 12-cup muffin tin with liners or spray with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
Whisk the flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon in a medium bowl until combined.  In a separate bowl, whisk the egg until the yolk & white are combined and light-colored.
Add the sugars and stir until the mixture is thick.
Add the melted butter in 2 or 3 additions, whisking slowly to combine after each addition.
Add the sour cream and whisk until JUST combined.  Do not overmix.

Add the peaches to the dry ingredients.  Slowly add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients in 2 or 3 additions, carefully folding after each addition.  Stir until the batter comes together, but try not to over mix.  The batter will be very, very thick.Spoon the batter into prepared muffin tins.  Fill the tins all the way to the top.  Not 2/3 or halfway filled, ALL the way to the brim.

Bake at 425F for 5 minutes.  Reduce oven temperature to 350F and continue to bake for 20-22 more minutes.  Allow to cool for 5 minutes.While the muffins are cooling, prepare the glaze by browning the butter in a medium saucepan on medium heat.  Stir constantly until butter is brown with a light nutty aroma, about 7 minutes.  Watch closely and do not burn.  Once browned, remove from heat and transfer to a small bowl.  Stir in sifted powdered sugar and milk/cream.  Stir until completely smooth.Once muffins are cooled, dip into brown butter glaze and sprinkle with cinnamon.
